title: Lady Pamela Hicks, the unlikely 'poshcaster' spilling royal secrets
text:
It is arguably not a great start, when interviewing Britain’s latest podcasting sensation, for them to ask: “And what is a podcast?”

But Lady Pamela Hicks is no ordinary digital star. At 90, the daughter of Lord Mountbatten has been persuaded to take to the airwaves by her daughter, India Hicks, to share her unique perspective on British history. And as Prince Philip’s first cousin and a lifelong friend of the Queen (for whom she was a bridesmaid), she can certainly lay claim to that.

Each episode is a delicious glimpse into a disappearing world: aristocratic love affairs and royal shenanigans in the dying days of Empire, warmly told by Lady Pamela, who has a wicked sense of comic timing and...
